text: Susan H. Morgan (born September 1, 1949) is an American Republican politician who served in the Oregon House of Representatives from 1999 until 2009. She served later on the Douglas County Board of Commissioners. ==Career== Morgan served on the South Umpqua Land Use Planning Advisory Committee from 1980 until 1998. She was elected to the Oregon House of Representatives in 1998, and served until 2009, representing southern Douglas County. Morgan was elected a Douglas County Commissioner in 2008, and was reelected in 2012. In 2015, she filed a lawsuit against Douglas County, arguing term limits on elected officials were unconstitutional. Some residents of the county started a recall effort against Morgan, but the proposal failed because they did not collect enough signatures by the deadline. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1949 births Category:Oregon Republicans Category:Members of the Oregon House of Representatives Category:People from Nanaimo Category:County commissioners in Oregon Category:Women state legislators in Oregon Category:20th-century American politicians Category:21st-century American politicians Category:University of Oregon alumni Category:People from Myrtle Creek, Oregon Category:Lane Community College alumni Category:20th- century American women politicians Category:21st-century American women politicians
title: Susan Morgan (politician)
